result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: however, appropriate rise in carrier lifetime allowed carriers to smoothly reach the surface of the material from the bulk, then migrated to the active site and reacted with the substrate, and enhanced the yield of target product (CO). To further understand transmission and separation behaviours of photogenerated charge, measurements of conduction band (CB) and valence band (VB) were proceeding.The general CB and VB of the heterostructure were determined via Mott-Schottky plot (M-S plot), the Tauc plots

the order shown in Fig. 5(b), comparing the column 1 and column 2 could prove that the catalyst does work in photocatalysis process and comparison between column 1 and column 3 indicates that the visible light was essential; when changing the air condition from CO 2 to Ar, only H 2 can be still traced so that the carbon element of CO comes from CO 2 (column 4).To more fully study 15 FPCN more completely, cycle tests were processed and the results showed that the rate of CO 2 reduction had slight decreased,

and 20 FPCN suspension.Further freeze-drying treatment helped us to obtain the desired product, and then the obtained was placed in a tube furnace and calcined at 200 C for 2 h in nitrogen atmosphere to obtain the final material. All photocatalytic activity tests were carried out in online photoreaction system (Labsolar-6A, Perfectlight, Beijing).10 mg sample was put into 300 mL Pyrex reactor, and 12 mL solvent (4 mL H 2 O, 6 mL acetonitrile and 2 mL TEOA) was added to dissolve the sample.Then, sealed the

the sample.Then, sealed the reactor and evacuate the air, and pumped pure CO 2 into the reactor all the time until the pressure inside of the reactor was 75 kPa.The reaction was underway at low temperature (10C), when with the 300 W xenon lamp (PLS-SXE 300C (BF), Perfectlight) irradiation, then the obtained gas product was analysed by gas chromatograph (GC2002, KeChuang, Shanghai), equipped with a hydrogen flame ionized detector (FID) and a thermal conductivity detector (TCD).The selectivity was calculated

from 2D g-C 3 N 4 to 2D BP, meanwhile the holes moved toward 2D BP surface, so that both became rivals to compete.But we had added the sacrificial agent (TEOA), which can capture the hole with oxidizing ability, this could greatly help to reduce the probability of carrier recombination and be better to make photogenerated electrons reach the surface and active sites to convert CO 2 into CO (Fig. 7c).To further figure out what a crucial role the electrons played in CO 2 photoreduction catalysis, the in situ

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

and 20 FPCN suspension.Further freeze-drying treatment helped us to obtain the desired product, and then the obtained was placed in a tube furnace and calcined at 200 C for 2 h in nitrogen atmosphere to obtain the final material. All photocatalytic activity tests were carried out in online photoreaction system (Labsolar-6A, Perfectlight, Beijing).10 mg sample was put into 300 mL Pyrex reactor, and 12 mL solvent (4 mL H 2 O, 6 mL acetonitrile and 2 mL TEOA) was added to dissolve the sample.Then, sealed the

based on our experimental results and the above theoretical analysis, a brief but complete diagram of the reaction mechanism was shown in Fig. 7(b,c).As shown in Fig. 7(b), 2D BP and 2D g-C 3 N 4 constructed a typical Type I heterostructure. Thus, in the whole photoreduction process, the composite with the abundant and active sites and lager surface could generate the carriers (electrons and holes) under the light irradiation, the electrons transferred across the interface from 2D g-C 3 N 4 to 2D BP,

was 187.7 mol g -1 h -1 , the numerical value was nearly twice as much as that of 2D g-C 3 N 4 .At the same time, its selectivity was up to 92.55.It should be also mentioned that changing BP shape from bulk into nanosheet could significantly promote its photocatalytic activity (from 22.1 to 97.1 mol g -1 h -1 ) and the competing reaction generating by-product (H 2 ) was always underway.Next, more attention was paid to 15 FPCN composite, the control experiments were done in the order shown in Fig. 5(b),
